frame.name: Billing
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Billing_authority</fen> communicates in written form that the <fen>Debtor</fen> owes the <fen>Owed_party</fen> (often the same as the <fen>Billing_authority</fen>) some amount of <fen>Money</fen> for certain <fen>Goods</fen> (including services) provided by the <fen>Owed_party</fen> or to clear a debt for a <fen>Bad_action</fen> by the <fen>Debtor</fen> against the <fen>Owed_party</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Debtor
FE.definition: <def-root>The person (or organization) that owes the <fen>Owed_party</fen>. <ex>The pizza man <t>billed</t> <fex name="Debtor">Lee</fex> $35 for his order.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction. <ex>The man at the counter <t>billed</t> Lee <fex name="Goods">for his dry-cleaning</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The means by which the billing occurs. <ex>The money was <t>billed</t> <fex name="Means">through a credit card transaction</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Money
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Money</fen> is the thing given in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen> in a transaction, or as recompense for the <fen>Bad_action</fen>. <ex>The clerk <t>invoiced</t> the little old lady <fex name="Money">$49.95</fex> for what she called "a little hand-holding . "</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition: <def-root>In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex>The cleaner <t>bills</t> <fex name="Rate">at forty dollars per hour</fex> for his services.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Owed_party
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Owed_party</fen> expects a specific amount of <fen>Money</fen> from the <fen>Debtor</fen>, either because the <fen>Debtor</fen> received <fen>Goods</fen> or because the <fen>Debtor</fen> performed a Bad_action against the Owed_party. <ex><fex name="Owed_party">The salesman</fex> never <t>billed</t> me , so I did n't pay .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Unit
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a <ment>by</ment> or <ment>per</ment>-PP.
<ex>I need a <fex name="Unit">per-item</fex> <t>invoice</t> !</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The purpose for which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fex name="Explanation">Explanation</fex> for which an event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the billing event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Seller</fen> that affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). <ex>He <fex name="Manner">carefully</fex> <t>collected</t> all his debts.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Billing_authority
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual who communicates to the <fen>Debtor</fen> the <fen>Money</fen> that they owe.</def-root>

FE.name: Payment_status
FE.definition: <def-root>Describes the relation between the invoice and the associated payment: unpaid, paid, overdue, etc.</def-root>

FE.name: Bad_action
FE.definition: <def-root>An earlier action by the <fen>Debtor</fen> causing harm (directly or indirectly) to the <fen>Owed_party</fen>, for which the <fen>Owed_party</fen> expects compensation, and therefore bills the <fen>Debtor</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: bill.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to inform of a debt in writing.

lexUnit.name: invoice.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to create and send a description of what is owed.

lexUnit.name: invoice.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a document (usually an itemized bill) for goods or services provided, issued by a seller to a buyer
